title: Can we please nerf Thresh, this is ridiculous.
body:
No champion should have such an overloaded kit.  I mean, why pick blitzcrank when you can just pick thresh and grab all the poros at once?

Edit:  The amount of people that haven't played through the Blitzcrank poro game surprises me.

replies.body:
OK, I can't really tell is OP is being sarcastic or not (Poros?) but whether or not he means it, he's right: Thresh is the most powerful support in the game and has been ever since his release.

He has the most absurdly overloaded kit of any support- his Lantern _alone_ is a more powerful defensive tool than some champions _entire kits,_ which lets your teammates play with careless abandon and screw up as much as they like and still waltz away scott free. His Q is simply the best hook of the three (him, Blitz, Nautilus)- it has better range, CD and mana cost than Blitzcranks, disables the opponent for the longest while he's dragging them in, it gives Thresh the _option_ (unlike the others) of choosing whether or not he wants to go in and make it a hard engagement with his E and ult (how many times have you Blitz hooked an enemy Alistar, Amumu or Leona and screwed up your team?), and oh, it also lets him jump walls- Naut can't even fire his hook through walls at all! Flay is one of the most powerful and versatile CCs in the game, capable of pulling opponents in or knocking them back at his discretion. His ult is an AMAZING disengage tool which can also be used offensively if Thresh jumps onto you with Q. Oh and unlike Naut and Blitz (and other all-in supports) he's RANGED, not melee. And just to add injury to injury, Flay gives him a damage buff on his autoattack harass.

All this adds up to make a support champion who not only has unique strengths that NO other support can provide (Dark Passage) but, more importantly, has_no weaknesses at all._ He's not squishy. He can all-in almost as well as the likes of Leona, but far more safely. He can both engage and disengage. He can _poke_ for fuck's sake! He has some of the best CC in the game. He even has a shield (on the Lantern, natch). Hell, pros play him with Relic Shield so he can even sustain (the bonus damage from his E makes up for not getting the execute proc when last hitting). If he has a weakness, I'd like you to tell me what it is, other than "he's not a dedicated healer" which will make you look like a retard. But we all know he has no weaknesses, and so do the pros, who have NEVER stopped playing Thresh for even a single patch ever since the day of his release. NO other champion has _ever_ been so utterly ubiquitous in the meta- he has literally _never_ not been a highly viable pro pick (I think he's the only champion _in the game_ who can claim this).

Thresh is CertainlyT's greatest success and also his greatest failure- a nightmarish balance monster who overshadows literally every other support in bot lane. He has NO bad matchups and fits EVERY team composition because he's simply flat-out too powerful.

OP means the game they released as promo along with Arcade Riven and Final Boss Blitz. The game consists on saving poros from Baron Nashor, while owning some champions on the way. Clearing the game with Blitz unlocks Thresh, who has a higher delay in his grab, but catches everything in it's range.

Also, add to your rant the free AP he gets from Souls. Ok, he has no scaling armor and needs to get it from Souls, but they also grant AP AND extra damage on his autoattack thanks to E's passive. What annoys me the most about the free AP is that Thresh was released by the time Supports build was boots, philo stone, and a shitload of wards and pink wards to wage Vision Wars with. In that context where the supports had no gold to spare on damage items to scale with, Thresh got AP for free...

Thresh Main reporting in.
You could argue that he gets free damage on his E from soul collecting. But beyond laning it's largely negligible. Sure a fully charged one can make a noticeable dent in say, an ADC's health bar but that's it. Against even the enemy team's fighters/bruisers it hardly touches them. 
Ontop of that his AP scaling on his abilities are ass (excluding the ulti but....that's an ult) Death Sentence and Flay also do negligible damage mid-late game. Which is what they should do, because they're CC abilities. Even if you built full AP on Thresh there are champions who can do more damage and in better ways. Also that's just not what Thresh does :P

So you can complain about him getting "infinite AP" from his passive but it really doesn't add up as much as the armor does, which even that takes time to get going. 

Just my two cents. 

(Oh I know tihs thread is just a jokey thread but your comment made it serious xD)
He also gets infinite armor. -_- Again: **infinite armor**
it stacks so slowly its not a problem it has a .75 ratio thats the lowest stack ratio in game and other can stack much faster
Pretty much you need to win lane to get as much base armor as anyone else, but you get free ap.   That AP is pretty much meh because Thresh needs to be built tank to initiate.
and you'll never get more than like 100 AP, which would barely increase his ability damages.
Actually I think Garen has lowest stack ratio now with his W passive...
im not sure about his new w passive tbh i just know his old scaled off bonus Armour and mr
Don't forget about large jungle monsters giving 1 :p
and champ kills

Veigar can get infinite AP, and it's a lot more useful for Veigar especially since his ratios are higher AND it's a lot easier for him to farm from range. 

Nevertheless, Veigar is not FOTM. 

You can argue that Thresh has a strong kit, but so do other supports like Bard or Braum. It's not that Thresh is OP per se, it's that the other supports are just all underpowered.
he's always FOTM for me....
Adding the delay to Veigar's E pretty much killed him. It was the only reliable way he could get W damage or finish off an enemy at all without ulting an AP.

which would be a strength in an hour long game....  if you were otherwise unfed? 

utterly useless aspect of his passive. if he had base armor he wouldn't need it.
You **obviously** didn't get my point. Look above, check the context, then delete your post.

my reading comprehension is fine. you made an invalid point. you highlighted a weakness of threshes and tried to construe it as a strength.  no, his armor infinitely scaling  with his passive is not an added bonus of an overloaded kit. it is counterbalanced by a weakness that thresh has to compensate for most (if not all) of the game. he is literally the squishiest "tank" in the game... having worse tanking stats than many carries. his AP scaling, as was mentioned earlier is at best a consolation prize.... and his E on hit damage, while useful... needs to be supplemented with items to be all that relevant.

cry OP on his utility all you want. there may be a valid line of discussion for that argument. but if you want to cry foul on stat numbers on a champ that has some of the worst stats in the game you should go spam a subreddit about it.

Nope, you still didn't get it. Try again.

_hint: i never said his armor stacking is op. have scooby-doo help you find clues_
GABY1 Why even bother replying or trying to construct an argument when you can't even read.
im not the only one who replied to your post and assumed that was the intent. it probably has more to do with your lack of communication skills than everyone's lack of reading comprehension

Nasus can get infinite Q stacks
Veigar can get infinite AP
Sion can get infinite Health
Bard can get infinite Meep Damage (but nobody cares about Bard's threat)

So using that as an argument is irrelevant because there are four other champions with an infinitely scaling stat.
Furthermore the number of souls dropped is regulated. If you're on quota for number of souls at a certain time the spawn rate will decreases. If you're behind the number you should have the spawn rate increases.
Excluding Bard, the other 3 only have to kill things to stack, meaning they can gain something every time. Whereas Thresh, only sometimes.

Now for the record I'm not arguing that Thresh DOESN'T have an overloaded kit. Just that his infinite scaling isn't as overboard as it's being made out to be.

The having to stack is actually his weakness.  He starts out with extremely low base armor and no armor growth per level.  I cant remember the exact number, but he needs a good amount to just equal Maokai, the highest base armor in the game. Most other tank supports are inherently some of the tankiest champs in the game.

Blitz is safer than thresh.. Thresh may have ranged autos but if he doesnt pull himself to you, he can't flay you. Mean while blitz knock up silence in the blink of an eye. Thresh is actually very well designed. Just imagine how much you'd complain if he were resourceless :P Thresh is arguably one of the best designed supports/champions in the game, if you say other supports aren't as good i'd disagree however even if that were true, why complain about thresh? Why not just let thresh raise the bar to what good supports should be? Also note that thresh has a wind up on his grab making it way easier to dodge than a blitz hook, also note blitz is way more devastating early game than thresh. Oh and his lantern is good.. but better than some champions entire kits? erm yeah.. THAT is a pretty crazy statement. Also for a tanky support he really starts out squishy early game, if you and your adc end up getting zoned there goes your adc's farm and your souls except for the few youll grab with your lantern.

> Thresh may have ranged autos but if he doesnt pull himself to you, he can't flay you. Mean while blitz knock up silence in the blink of an eye

Thresh flay has range. If Blitz doesnt pull himself to you, he cant knock you up either. And no, Thresh can flay your ass without Q, it has range and is aoe.

> Just imagine how much you'd complain if he were resourceless :P  

Just imagine how worse Hitler would be if he killed twice the number of people? You see how completely ridiculous this argument is?

>even if that were true, why complain about thresh? Why not just let thresh raise the bar to what good supports should be  

Because thats fucking boring. He's isn't good because he has a strength, a niche that makes sth interesting. He's good because he is good at everything. Bringing everyone up to his level means everyone does everything, and that kills the game when an entire champion pool has to be good at everything

> also note blitz is way more devastating early game than thresh

Level 2 calculation: Blitz land a grab and his E and one auto. That's 80 magic + 186 (300% AD) physical = 266, and a pull and a knock up. Thresh land his grab and his E and one auto. That's 80 magic + 48 (100% AD) + 38.4 (80% AD) + 65 = 231, and a pull, a 1.5 stun, a knock up and back and a slow. Blitz puts out marginally more damage (30 damage) while bringing less to the table, shifting more and more in Thresh favor as he naturally gain soul. Thresh ult also has better base and same scaling as Blitz.

>if you and your adc end up getting zoned there goes your adc's farm and your souls 

Champion being weak when losing is not an example of their weakness.

Champions being weak when losing isn't a weakness? Good then you'd agree that riven has no weakness :P Back on to topic now!  Blitz doesnt pull himself to you. He pulls you to him. If thresh pulls himself to you he puts himself in danger while a blitz pull keeps your team safe and sound. Blitz q is also way easier to land as it's less predictable and faster missile speed. Comparing a game to hitler is far more ridiculous my friend. Blitzcrank is the stale one compared to thresh. q,e,r . Thresh has his w which is the only ability of it's kind. Blitz knock up is also longer, and his ult is on a 30 second cool down at rank 3 as compared to blitz. Blitz grab also has way higher scaling. Blitz can also momentarily chase harder. Also it's not gonna shift to thresh because rarely does a blitz get zero ap. :P

Im pretty sure Riven's weakness is her squishiness and her over-reliance on spell. Blitz knock up for 1 second and his pull stun for 0.5 second. Thresh Q stun for 1.5 second. 2 of blitz spell only equal to the cc time of one of Thresh spell. Thresh E passive gain power based on the number of souls he has AND it gives him more AP.

i disagree entirely with your analysis.  yes, he has a lot in his kit, but think about it in the sense of racing games.  there's always the guys that are super fast, or have great acceleration or control, but they were always bad at everything else.  then there was the one guy that's basically just average at everything.  thresh is that guy.  he can't beat any support at their own game.  essentially, he HAS to be able to outplay the enemy to win.  he isnt just strong at making plays, it's necessary that he does (unless the enemy support is just bad at that role, then he can beat them at their own game).
People think that you are talking about league...
Lmao xD The number of people that post without context is hilarious. {{champion:98}} /10
No matter which game you're talking about, its still true

This thread is so full of whoosh it's actually a bit scary...

On the subject of the poro game, are you supposed to be able to do something other than lose as Corki? I mean... Is he literally just a joke character there or what?
I know what OP is Talking about And I can't even get Halfway through Piltover... ;^;
I mean, yeah maybe Nautilus is just as good, I haven't unlocked him yet.  But you can grab as many poros as you want with thresh, that's just op man.
He's not. He's good, but he's not as good as Thresh. Not even close.

Nerf his cooldown he can grab a poro a second. Like thats so op. Also buff katerina, she didnt stand a chance against him.

Edit: Play the blitz poro game and then read my comment again before downvoting....

# #Ballanced
LOL i was talking about the arcade blitz game. Thresh can kick kats ass in 30 seconds.
Blitz grab is like 0.75 cooldown also... just spam your space bar...
Why complain about Thresh when abominations like Riven and Vayne exist?

Thresh is an abomination in his own right.

Also, OP, I understand what you tried to do, but unfortunately the champion you picked for your joke is indeed an overpowered, overloaded monster. Riot only made two significant nerfs to him: Moving the autoattack bonus passive from Q to E, and keeping the shield to only one ally (used to shield all allies...), and yet he still remains as the most picked support for the longest time. If Sona or Janna had his pick rate by half the time Thresh did, the would have already been gutted.

Riot only made two significant nerfs to him: Moving the autoattack bonus passive from Q to E, and keeping the shield to only one ally (used to shield all allies...), and yet he still remains as the most picked support for the longest time. If Sona or Janna had his pick rate by half the time Thresh did, the would have already been gutted.

Thresh actually got tons of more nerfs but whatever 
Aoe box damage
Q flash 
bigger base hitbox
etc

> [{quoted}](name=Sub HeroCro,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=kq0Eps8x,comment-id=000400000000,timestamp=2015-08-21T15:11:01.895+0000)

> Q flash 

May God have mercy of us all if he was allowed to keep that bug as a feature.
Also I mean significant, as in "Janna's tornado knockup now scales with time" kind of importance. With Thresh, the lanten could give no shield at all and it'd still be very powerful tool for engage and disengage.
AA range nerf not significant?  You don't play much botlane, do you?

I forgot that one, thanks. Still, a champion like Sona, for example, would be completely useless with a 450 range since she has no way to deal with an all in, but Thresh at that range has less margin to miss Q, and follow it up with W to his lane partner, Q to close in and E to ruin escape attempts (the basic all in combo). 
The W shield nerf is the most serious of Thresh nerfs, yet by far the most needed, as shielding 4 champions from afar was just ridiculous considering the utility the lantern provides in addition. 
Moving The autoattack bonus to E made it so Thresh would not have access to his two most powerful offensive tools at the same time. That was a more serious hit to his lane harass power, and was so required that it was performed in the patch following his release.

Thresh kit OP. Why play Blitz when you can double grab Poros? Plus the Thresh shuffle is cooler looking. OP. (Hint: If you're not getting it, play the arcade game.)

Edit: This is hilarious how many people didn't even read the OP.
The amount of people who took this seriously {{champion:412}} /10

As a Diamond 5 thresh support main, I feel my opinion bears some merit.  It is true that thresh has an extremely strong kit.  I've tried to make a guide on mobafire for him, but wasn't able to, simply because the correct way to build thresh is to build how the team needs you!  Thresh brings everything to the table a team could want: heavy crowd control, the ability to peel, high damage, and an escape for his ADC, as his own escape if you use his Q cleverly.

However, Thresh is not overpowered.  The advantage of Thresh is his versatility; he can be used as a blindpick any day without question because he fits into most any team.  Thresh has many disadvantages in response to this, which I list below:

           * Thresh falls off after the early/midgame.
Thresh's main advantage is his E/Q combo at level 2, which can all-in most support/adc combinations of the day.  However, if the enemy dodges the combo, a huge powerspike is lost to Thresh.  The same goes at levels 3, 6, and 11.  After these points, thresh's entire kit relies on landing a hook, which despite what someone with less experience might tell you, is easy to avoid.
           * Thresh has clear counters and comparable supports to battle with.
If you think thresh is the only one who plays the way he does, or is the strongest in lane, you aren't playing right.  Thresh has equal or lesser strength to braum and leona, and is flat out countered by morgana and alistar, who can negate his combo's.  Thresh isn't leagues ahead of these other supports; I could take any one of these others and have comperable results.
           * Thresh relies on his team's lead and his earlygame to win.
Thresh's main strength is his powerful laning phase and deadly earlygame ganks.  After this point, however, he becomes useless if his team can't find a lead.  In fact, if his team is behind, Thresh can dig a deeper hole for his team with misplaced hooks, stupid dives, attempted rescues, poor roams, and baits on his team.  In addition, Thresh's passive, collecting souls, makes his armor fall off of the other supports' levels if he can't reach them.
           * Thresh can't peel as well as other supports.
Thresh actually has poor peel.  Don't believe me?  Just try keeping their tank off of your ADC when you're behind, and we'll see whose right.  If you compare the peel of Thresh to someone such as leona, braum, nami, janna, morgana, alistar, or even Karma, you can see how he isn't amazing.  Any of these other supports has a better method of peeling, usually with the aid of a targeted ability.  Leona? bash with shield and jump on them.  Braum?  Auto them so they can be stunned by your ADC.  Nami?  Heal your adc, make them move fast, and pool the attacker.  Janna?  Play as janna and get freelo.  Morgana? spellshield your adc and root them for 500 years.  Alistar?  Pulverize and headbutt.  Karma?  Root, slow, move fast, and shield to peel them.  By comparison, Thresh isn't as strong as you might think.  All of his abilities are either skillshot or rely on him positioning away from the fight, which you generally don't do with thresh.  If you miss your Q, you have a 10s CD.  If you miss your E, you're screwed and have to use your ult.  If you throw out your lantern, the enemy can just toss a ward on it and your ADC is screwed.  To be fair, Thresh isn't hopeless for peeling, but the point is that most other supports are better, other than thresh using his lantern to help an out of position target.
 
I like to compare Thresh to Lee Sin, or irelia: usable in practically any composition due to their strong earlygame/midgame, but falls off during the lategame to a position not nearly as effective as other choices.

> [{quoted}](name=BaldursGateII,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=kq0Eps8x,comment-id=0023,timestamp=2015-08-21T21:08:21.422+0000)
>
>            * Thresh falls off after the early/midgame.

Um, his damage might, but since he is the only support with infinitely scaling armor and since his strong utility never falls off, I would say that saying he falls off is misleading.

> [{quoted}](name=BaldursGateII,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=kq0Eps8x,comment-id=0023,timestamp=2015-08-21T21:08:21.422+0000)
>            * Thresh can't peel as well as other supports.
> Thresh actually has poor peel.  

 While some supports like Alistar may have better peel than him, Thresh by no means has *poor* peel. His disables and repositions, knock-ups and slows make him one of the **best** peel supports in the entire game, especially with CDR which is commonly built on Thresh.

I play lots of Thresh, and the thing is that he does *way* too much far too well. He has strong safe engage, very strong "lockdown" (hook into flay into box or any combo means you're not going anywhere), insane disengage, and strong team fight presence while scaling into a very strong tank.  Oh, and the ability to reposition allies and save their butts all game long. Yeah, he is overloaded and too powerful.

tfw you're just trying to make a joke about poro roundup and everyone takes it seriously, Thresh gets nerfed next patch for being able to grab too many poros and everyone blames you
